website_summaries.verdict: Elite: Dangerous is a fascinating exploration of space that will endlessly appeal to some players and thoroughly bore others.
pros: Offers complete freedom in how you play
Remarkable sense of space and scope

customer_reviews.title: Great space flight sim.
customer_reviews.text: Steep learning curve. If you're patient this game has a lot to offer. The first 2-3 hours you will hate it and then things get easier. I'm encouraged that they keep adding things to it even if it takes them a long time to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Not a bot

customer_reviews.title: guess I am cooked
customer_reviews.text: Used instructions to get download but says not in Frontier libray.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Takahashi

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: 200 hours in and can't wait to see more content!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan C. Kittl

customer_reviews.title: Not enough interaction
customer_reviews.text: Not very many people seem to be playing this game and it's all online-based with no plot, just mini-quests with AI.
customer_reviews.author: Nick M

customer_reviews.title: The game is beautiful and the screenshots are only a minor portion of ...
customer_reviews.text: Been playing for over a year and it's still my go-to game. Always a lot to do, a huge galaxy to explore, and the developer is always coming out with new features. The game is beautiful and the screenshots are only a minor portion of the incredible things you'll see. If you enjoy science fiction and the idea of making your way in a ship, this game is right up your alley.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Not a sale when the price is jacked up
customer_reviews.text: Stop jacking up the price to "put it on sale." This edition won't get you everything, Elite Dangerous Horizons is needed for that. If you can find that version, on sale or not, it's worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Don V

customer_reviews.title: Good but not for all gamers.
customer_reviews.text: A good flight simulator that could benefit from more depth. [...]
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Might be good, but horrible VR user experience.
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving such a low score because the setup process is a real pain in the neck and they really need to cater more to VR users. First of all they shouldn't have put the character setup in VR if it doesn't even work in VR! I mean, are you kidding me guys? I had to look up this guide on the internet and it was a 6-step process, and that's not even including the account setup and verification email: [...] Plus, can someone tell me what the heck HMD means? Apparently this is important. This is just very sloppy work with regards to user experience and I hope I get the attention of the game developers.
customer_reviews.author: Leighton

customer_reviews.title: I think it's an amazing game with an enormous galaxy to explore
customer_reviews.text: Yeah but mine craft does the same thing with no tutorials, I think it's an amazing game with an enormous galaxy to explore
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Pratt

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: boring game not much to do other then run around a lot don't waste your money on it !
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Makes no sense.
customer_reviews.text: This game is a total waste of money. It's got great graphics. But that's it. You can't complete a mission because contrary to an sort of sense, if you head to a solar system. The time to destination actually increases instead of decreases. So you will never get there.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Phillips

product_meta.title: Elite Dangerous [Online Game Code]
product_meta.description:
Platform:PC Online Game Code

Take control of your own starship in a cutthroat galaxy. [i]Elite: Dangerous[/i] brings gaming’s original open world adventure into the modern generation with a connected galaxy, evolving narrative and the entirety of the Milky Way re-created at its full galactic proportions.

[i]Elite: Dangerous[/i] is the definitive massively multiplayer space epic, bringing gaming’s original open world adventure to the modern generation with a connected galaxy, evolving narrative and the entirety of the Milky Way re-created at its full galactic proportions.

Starting with only a small starship and a few credits, players do whatever it takes to earn the skill, knowledge, wealth and power to survive in a futuristic cutthroat galaxy and to stand among the ranks of the iconic Elite. In an age of galactic superpowers and interstellar war, every player’s story influences the unique connected gaming experience and handcrafted evolving narrative. Governments fall, battles are lost and won, and humanity’s frontier is reshaped, all by players’ actions. 

400 Billion Star Systems. Infinite Freedom. Blaze Your Own Trail.

[b]A Galaxy Of Wonders[/b]The 400 billion star systems of the Milky Way are the stage for [i]Elite: Dangerous[/i]' open-ended gameplay. The real stars, planets, moons, asteroid fields and black holes of our own galaxy are built to their true epic proportions in the largest designed playspace in videogame history.

[b]A Unique Connected Game Experience[/b]Governments fall, battles are lost and won, and humanity’s frontier is reshaped, all by players’ actions. In an age of galactic superpowers and interstellar war, every player’s personal story influences the connected galaxy and handcrafted evolving narrative.

[b]Blaze Your Own Trail[/b]Upgrade your ship and customize every component as you hunt, explore, fight, mine, smuggle, trade and survive in the cutthroat galaxy of the year 3301. Do whatever it takes to earn the skill, knowledge, wealth and power to stand among the ranks of the Elite.

[b]Massively Multiplayer[/b]Experience unpredictable encounters with players from around the world in [i]Elite: Dangerous[/i]’ vast massively multiplayer space. Experience the connected galaxy alone in Solo mode or with players across the world in Open Play, where every pilot you face could become a trusted ally or your deadliest enemy. You will need to register a free [i]Elite: Dangerous[/i] account with Frontier to play the game.

[b]A Living Game[/b][i]Elite: Dangerous[/i] grows and expands with new features and content. Major updates react to the way players want to play and create new gameplay opportunities for the hundreds of thousands of players cooperating, competing and exploring together in the connected galaxy.

[b]The Original Open World Adventure[/b][i]Elite: Dangerous[/i] is the third sequel to 1984's genre-defining Elite, bringing gaming’s original open world adventure into the modern generation with a connected galaxy, evolving narrative and the entire Milky Way re-created at its full galactic proportions.
PC Minimum System Requirements:PC Recommended System Requirements: * Processor: Quad Core CPU (4 x 2Ghz)
 * RAM: 4 GB RAM
 * Hard Disk: 7 GB available space
 * Video Card: Nvidia GTX 260 / ATI 4870HD
 * Supported OS: Windows 8, Windows 7

 * Processor: Intel Core i7-3770K Quad Core CPU or better / AMD FX 4350 Quad Core CPU or better
 * RAM: 8 GB RAM
 * Hard Disk: 7 GB available space
 * Video Card: Nvidia GTX 770 / AMD Radeon R9 280X
feature_bullets: Explore, trade, fight and survive from the cockpit of your spaceship in Elite Dangerous' massively multiplayer galaxy.
Governments fall, wars are lost and won, and humanity’s frontier is reshaped, all by players’ actions.
